channel.title: numpy on Notes
channel.description: Recent content in numpy on Notes

item.title: CS177-lecture-20220210
item.description: NumPy # We can use NumPy with import numpy as np We can create new arrays with a = np.array([1, 5, 7]) We can specify number of dimensions or data types: b = np.array([1, 2, 3], ndim=2) c = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4], dtype=complex) We can see the shape of an array via print(a) print(a.shape) You can set the shape of an array d = np.array([1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]) d.
